title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin with the sixth worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the sixth worker (30) is less than the MP of the fifth worker (40).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin with the sixth worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the sixth worker (30) is less than the MP of the fifth worker (40).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the third worker as $90 and/or does not show the work.

MRP = P × MP = $3 × 30 = $90 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E37@

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the third worker as $90 and shows the work.

MRP = P × MP = $3 × 30 = $90 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E37@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 7 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 7th worker ($60) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($40), but the MRP of the 8th worker ( −$6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaGGKaGaaGOnaaaa@3B51@ ) is less than the MRC ($40).

The response states that 7 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 7th worker ($60) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($40), but the MRP of the 8th worker ( −$6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaGGKaGaaGOnaaaa@3B51@ ) is less than the MRC ($40).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market would decrease and explains that a decrease in the productivity of workers will decrease the demand for labor in the market for machinists.

· States that the wage rate Ahmal’s Manufacturing Company will pay will decrease and explains that the decrease in the market demand for labor will decrease the market wage, which decreases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market would decrease and explains that a decrease in the productivity of workers will decrease the demand for labor in the market for machinists.

· States that the wage rate Ahmal’s Manufacturing Company will pay will decrease and explains that the decrease in the market demand for labor will decrease the market wage, which decreases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market would decrease and explains that a decrease in the productivity of workers will decrease the demand for labor in the market for machinists.

· States that the wage rate Ahmal’s Manufacturing Company will pay will decrease and explains that the decrease in the market demand for labor will decrease the market wage, which decreases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.
